rows.transcript_1:
Close your eyes and think about the day. 

Name one thing that you are grateful for. 
Name one thing that you did well. 
Name one thing that you love.

Well done, you are a hero!
rows.transcript_2:
Tutup mata anda dan fikirkan tentang hari ini.

Sebut satu perkara yang anda rasa bersyukur.
Sebut satu perkara yang anda lakukan dengan baik.
Sebut satu perkara yang anda sayangi.
Bagus sekali, anda memang hebat!
rows.title: One thing today

text_1.eng: Recognising how you feel is key to handling life well. Be real and kind to yourself.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: You are a star. And you are making a real difference. You can be proud of yourself.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Everyone has good and bad days. Well done for using this app. It shows you are a committed parent. Remember to praise yourself for it!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry that things are not easy today. All parents have these days. You are trying and moving forward!

section_1_text.eng:
ğŸ”´ Counting is a skill your child can start to learn early. 1ï¸âƒ£2ï¸âƒ£3ï¸âƒ£

ğŸš— Ask your child to count things around you: cars, people, houses, and their fingers and toes! ğŸ‘‹

ğŸ… Ask your child to count things in daily activities: like potatoes while cooking, or socks while sorting out clothes

ğŸµ Sing songs that include numbers with your child.

ğŸ¨ Encourage your child to draw things, or ask them how many things there are in the pictures.

section_2_text.eng:
ğŸ“±Numbers are all around us if you look for them. Theyâ€™re on food packaging, and even on the TV remote.

ğŸ‘€ Wherever you see a number, ask your child what it is. 

ğŸ˜ƒ Help them if they donâ€™t know!

section_3_text.eng:
ğŸ”· your child can also learn through shapes! Shapes are everywhere, too, so find them and talk about them. ğŸ‘€
ğŸ”´ Help your child draw different shapes. 
ğŸ”µ If you can, cut them out and help your child sort them into groups (by colour, shape, size, or however else your child wants!) Ask them why they are sorting in that way.
ğŸ”¶ Talk about the shapes with your child, and have fun with them! ğŸ˜ƒ

quiz_1_question.eng: Hereâ€™s a home activity for today! â­ Try to involve your child in an activity with numbers. For example, counting the amount of ingredients when you are cooking. Do you have time today?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! ğŸ’™ Involving your child in activities like this and talking about numbers and amounts of things will help them learn!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's OK! If you don't have time today, try to involve your child tomorrow. Activities that use numbers and talking about amounts of things will help your child learn!
